title: Ticket #2414: condor_hadoop fails an assertion
description:
If HDFS_DENY, HOSTDENY_WRITE, and HOSTDENY_READ are all undefined in the configuration, condor_hadoop fails an assertion and exits, shortly after starting up.

The workaround is to define a dummy value for HDFS_DENY.

A similar problem causes an assertion to fail if HDFS_ALLOW, HOSTDENY_WRITE, HOSTDENY_READ, ALLOW_WRITE, and ALLOW_READ are empty. Note how DENY only looks at the old-fashioned HOST attributes, whereas ALLOW looks at both.

The assertion was added in #2315 in order to prevent a NULL string from being passed as the parameter value to writeXMLParam().
